> Why does a TestCase inherit all of its assertion routines?

AFAIK it's only for convenience.

> That led me to start thinking about whether it might not be cleaner and
> simpler, overall, to completely separate the assertion code from the test
> cases by using separate assertion objects for everything.

several assertion classes have already been developed and can be found 
in the JUnit-addons library.  (sorry for the xth repetition...)

If someone wants to donate some StringAssert class to fix the previously 
discussed problem, I'll be happy to include it into the codebase (or 
other idea are welcome).

-Vladimir

<http://junit-addons.sf.net>
